title: Gen. Raymond Odierno, Who Commanded U.S. Forces in Iraq, Dies at 67
sub_head: Retired general had military career that spanned many decades and countries
body:
Raymond T. Odierno, a retired Army general who commanded American and coalition forces in Iraq at the height of the war and capped a 39-year career by serving as the Army’s chief of staff, has died, his family said Saturday. He was 67.
“The general died after a brave battle with cancer; his death was not related to Covid,” a family statement said.
